reviewText: Roxette is one of the most influential duos on the face of this planet, this DVD covers every single hit they made, plus newest videos and some of their spanish language videos, as far as quality of the DVD : newer videos have great sound and picture, older songs sound so so, but it's not that bad really, the main thing is, now you can hold in your arms the proof of Roxette's strong existence in the world of music,
summary: ROXETTE - PAST AND PRESENT IN YOUR HANDS !!!

reviewText: I bought it few days ago and just watched it today. It has over 30 videos and includes an internew with Roxette, plus extras! I totally loved it. It has many of the new videos like Milk, toast and honey, Anyone, You don't understand me, and also lots of the old ones. This is a must have for any of Roxette fans!
Title: N/A

reviewText: I had to purchase this last month to replace my "All Videos Ever Made & More" cause my DVD burner that was able to play it went out. And wouldn't you know it my new DVD burner couldn't play it. The only difference between the two DVD's is of course this DVD has the latest 2 videos "A Thing About You" and "Opportunity Nox" added on here. So you get all of Roxette's official videos on this DVD. What's missing on this DVD that is on "All Videos Ever Made & More" is the alternate videos for "Neverending Love", "It Must Have Been Love", "I Call Your Name", and "The Look". Plus a rare video of "Silver Blue", which is just a tour footage. Now of course I'll still keep my "All Videos Ever Made & More" since it does play on my computer, for the alternate videos. Don't know why the alternate videos just wasn't added on here, but can't complain, overall you get all of Roxette's official videos."1986: Pearls Of Passion"29. Neverending Love  (#3 Sweden)30. Title: N/A

reviewText: First of all, let me say I love Roxette and this is one great video collection! My only complaint is the video for "It must have been love". I have the vhs tape containing songs in video form from the movie "Pretty Woman", and the one on the tape is Roxette only, no footage from the movie at all. This is the video I came to love from repeated viewings, and the one I expected to find  on this DVD collection. Not so..this one contains Richard Gere and Julia Roberts all over the place and is a little distracting. Why couldn't the same video from the vhs tape be placed on the DVD? The truth is, I love the song and hate the movie. Oh well, this is probably only nitpicking and really doesn't take anything away from the DVD collection.As I say, this is one great video collection and well worth the money, if you're a Roxette fan.Buy it, enjoy it, and if you happen to own the vhs collection I mentioned, keep it as well.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Based on my experience, and many other reviewers here, you have to want this a lot to take a chance on ordering it.Fortunately the way Amazon stands behind what it sells, your risk may be small enough to see if it'll work for you.IT FAILED MISERABLY FOR ME.OK IN A PC?When I first got it I was encouraged. I popped into a Windows 7 HP PC. It played in a DVD/CD drive in the PC so I thought I was home free.  The sound was pretty good.  But the graphic quality of the videos was all over the place. One would look OK with good resolution, while the next one looked like you were trying to watch an abstract painting!NO GOOD ANYWHERE ELSE?Still optimistically I told my wife we had a Roxette DVD to watch and popped it into the Panasonic RV31 DVD player that's part of our home entertainment system. NO ENTERTAINMENT HERE!  The DVD seemed to load but there was some undecipherable audio while it loaded. Then it JUST TOTALLY LOCKED UP ON THE MAIN MENU. The only thing you could do is eject the disc. It is noteworthy that the Panasonic DVD player plays DVD Video and plays every DVD we own perfectly.Good luck if you decide to try this DVD.
summary: HOW BAD DO YOU WANT IT
Title: N/A

reviewText: The aforementioned Really Roxette sychronication problem aside, this is an enjoyable and informative DVD with some interesting behind-the-scenes looks at a contemporary, intelligent rock group.  You might call it the polar opposite of "This Is Spinal Tap."I personally liked the point of commentary in one documentary describing Roxette as a "young-people band" (for fans age 13 - 19 or so).  I didn't discover Roxette until I was 45, and I was immediately captivated by their great tunes and magnificent lyrics (Per Gessle's superb song-writing, coupled with a dynamite female vocalist who can really belt 'em out!).If you're a Roxette fan, you need to own this DVD.  It's worth it, even with the minor, easy-to-ignore flaws.
Title: N/A

reviewText: There is one good live performance of Listen to Your Heart. The rest of it is not that interesting. Not a keeper. Most of the videos focus on the guitar player and backup singer rather than Roxette for some reason.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Wow! What a great DVD. I was a bit skeptical at first about buying this when reading other peoples reviews. But I did not find any errors, no deleyad sync, or any probelms with the viedo quality. They must have corrected that error.what amazes me is how well this package has been put together. Instead of ripping you off with 12 or so clips, this one contains 35 video clips, + 5 rareities including 2 early video clips, 2 TV performances, tho there not live, and one rare clip. And then a 50 minute documentry called "the making of joyride" and another one that goes for 60 minutes called "really roxette"It is great to see a compant finally put a DVD together worth buying. Every video clip seems to be here. Including rareties and documentries, but what has amazed me the most is it is all on one disc!Even tho I wasnt to crash hot on the type of techno direction towards the 2001 era, the songs where great, I only had the album "dont bore us, get to the chorus" and all but one song from that greatest hits is on here, and I liked alot of the ones I was watching for the first time too. Its a must have for the Roxette fan.
Title: N/A

reviewText: All the videos hits are here - one can fully appreciate the superb technique of their production and the amazing talents of this group.Start playing this disc and the years slip away, this was a great group and their hits stand the test of time.A great collection guaranteeing many future hours of enjoyment and well worth every penny.
